text:
Hey guys!
Any idea, how to display the cookie banner only for EU visitor?
I can't do by URL, as my /fr/ is mostly used for Quebec visitor as well as French, and the default domain for US visitor as well as EU visitor :slightly_smiling_face:
You can uncheck the banner
Thanks Sebastien!

I’ve been spending my morning reading about GDPR regulations because I was hoping to do the same thing.

I’ll start by saying that I’m not a lawyer, but my understanding is that GDPR applies to all EU residents wherever they are in the world.

Displaying a banner to visitors located in the EU is not sufficient for compliance as an EU resident may visit your site while travelling outside the EU.

In this day and age, it’s looking like obtaining consent from visitors no matter where they are located.

On the topic of the cookie consent banner, am I right in thinking that consenting to this banner will only impact HubSpot tracking cookies?  i.e. if you have some other marketing automation tools that are cookieing users, the consent banner wouldn’t have any impact on those other tools
thats my understanding. I remember reading something about using apis to have it effect other cookies if you wanted to set that up
Thanks for verifying <@UEC65BQV8>
You're right
<@U2H3TT8F2> any updates on this? I'm curious

Hey Juan, ill loop back in with folks as its been some time since this was raised. Are people still seeing this issue (<@UD53A9UUR>)? Would you be able to send me some examples (can be DM if needed) of pages where you are seeing pagespeed issues?
i havent retested.  I can update soon with a new site build i am working on
hold me to it
<@UGDF9EBPW>, you should check as well :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks Dennis, I will
let me know what you all find out :slightly_smiling_face:
You bet! here's the resource around using it for third party cookies
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/get_consent_status?_ga=2.23391100.770318563.1570651500-1131703028.1565173669>
from here:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/customize-your-cookie-tracking-settings-and-privacy-policy-alert>
Oh wow.  This is great stuff.  Thanks very much!
